data.headline: January CPI came in cooler than expected at +0.2% MoM and 2.4% YoY, reinforcing disinflation trends
bullets: Fed rate-cut expectations for 2024 increased, leading to softer Treasury yields
S&P 500 and Nasdaq ended slightly weaker as AI-driven tech selling intensified
Dow declined while the Russell 2000 outperformed, highlighting small-cap strength
Applied Materials surged on strong AI chip-tool demand and over 20% growth guidance
Rivian jumped after a Q4 beat and bullish 2026 R2 outlook
Moderna and Coinbase advanced on positive earnings momentum
Pinterest and DraftKings plunged, with additional pressure seen in Roku, Expedia, and metals stocks like Nucor and Alcoa due to tariff concerns
Traders focused on small-cap outperformance, EV/semiconductor rotation, and persistent AI sector volatility
